definitions.definition: an unfair and unreasonable opinion or feeling, especially when formed without enough thought or knowledge:
examples: Laws against racial prejudice must be strictly enforced.

definitions.definition: If a decision or action is made without prejudice to a right or claim, it is made without having an effect on that right or claim:
examples: My client accepts the formal apology without prejudice to any further legal action she may decide to take.

definitions.definition: Someone or something that prejudices you influences you unfairly so that you form an unreasonable opinion about something:
examples: His comments may have prejudiced the voters against her.

definitions.definition: Something or someone that prejudices something else has a harmful influence on it:
examples: The fact that you were late all this week may prejudice your chances of getting a promotion.
